intro: Homeria maximiliani, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are often hairy. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
